newsitem.title: UK: World drug sales up 7 pct in 11 months to Nov - IMS.
newsitem.headline: World drug sales up 7 pct in 11 months to Nov - IMS.

text.p: Pharmaceutical sales in 10 of the world's major markets rose seven percent in local currency terms in the 11 months to November 1996, market researcher IMS International said on Monday.
IMS said the strongest gains in local currency terms were seen in the U.S, up 11 percent, Italy, up 12 percent, and Britain, where they rose 10 percent.

Strongest growth by therapeutic category was seen in blood agents, where sales rose 16 percent to 7.78 billion stg, central nervous system, up 14 percent to 18.34 billion stg and cytostatics, up 12 percent to 3.56 billion stg.
